New Records: Victor Wembanyama set a career-high with 50 points
Wembanyama is the first player in league history with 20 three-pointers and 25 blocks over a six-game span
Key Match Events: Wembanyama made an 18-foot jumper for his 49th and 50th points with 8:49 remaining to give San Antonio a 115-98 lead
Alexandre Sarr blocked Wembanya's shot in the second quarter and dunked on his fellow Frenchman in the third quarter
Pre-Game Insights: Wembanyama is focused on Friday's matchup against the Los Angeles Lakers to open the Emirates NBA Cup
Post-Match Reflections: Wembanyama was already focused on Friday's matchup against the Los Angeles Lakers to open the Emirates NBA Cup
The Spurs host Los Angeles Lakers on Friday night in the final game of a five-game homestand
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wembanyama is the eighth player in franchise history to score 50 points
David Robinson holds the franchise record with 71 points against the Los Angeles Clippers on April 24, 1994
Others: Wembanyama is the fourth-youngest player to score 50 points, trailing only Brandon Jennings (20/52), LeBron James (20/80) and Devin Booker (20/145)
